title: Augusta Country: Henry H. Dedrick to Mary E. A. Dedrick, October 4, 1861
summary: Dedrick talks about the health of friends in his Company and about nearby actions at Greenbrier River and Cheat Mountain. He also mentions that he has no money to send home and that his wife should sell some rye or a calf for money.
keywords: Battle Description, Camp Life, Church/Religious Activity, Death/Casualties, Family, Home Front, Medicine/Hospitals, Troop Movement, American Civil War
